texto: ISO 9004:2018(E) ﻿ 5.3 External and internal issues 5.3.1 External issues are factors that exist outside of the organization that can affect the organization’s ability to achieve sustained success, such as: a) statutory and regulatory requirements; b) sector-specific requirements and agreements; c) competition; d) globalization; e) social, economic, political and cultural factors; f) innovations and advances in technology; g) natural environment. 5.3.2 Internal issues are factors that exist within the organization itself that can affect the organization’s ability to achieve sustained success, such as: a) size and complexity; b) activities and associated processes; c) strategy; d) type of
